clarity_of_reasoning.description: The extent to which the agent's reasoning steps are understandable and logical.

accepted_values.none: The reasoning provided is incoherent or absent.
accepted_values.low: The reasoning is present but hard to follow or understand.
accepted_values.moderate: The reasoning is fairly clear and logical.
accepted_values.high: The reasoning is very clear, well-structured, and logical.

adherence_to_instructions.description: How closely the agent follows the given set of instructions.

accepted_values.partial: Instructions followed partially; some elements are missing or incorrect.

accuracy.description: The correctness of the answers provided by the agent to the posed questions.

accepted_values.25%: Fewer than half of the answers are correct.
accepted_values.50%: Half of the answers are correct.
accepted_values.75%: Most of the answers are correct.

problem_solving_efficiency.description: How efficiently the agent navigates through the steps required to answer questions.

accepted_values.inefficient: The agent takes unnecessary or convoluted steps to solve the problem.
accepted_values.moderately_efficient: The agent solves the problem with a reasonable amount of steps.
accepted_values.highly_efficient: The agent takes the most direct and efficient steps to solve the problem.

data_contamination_prevention.description: The ability of the agent to provide answers without relying on possibly contaminated external data sources.

accepted_values.none: Relies solely on external data which may be contaminated.
accepted_values.low: Mostly relies on external data with minimal internal reasoning.
accepted_values.moderate: Balances use of internal reasoning and external data.
accepted_values.high: Primary reliance on internal reasoning and knowledge to minimize contamination.
